page.title: 04STREAMS (2): WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: An attempt was made in mid June to measure the channel and flow characteristics of the streams in the area, but there were difficulties. The {Weald Brook,}the most sizeable stream, has cut down about 2m. below its nettle-strewn banks, and its bed is very soft. Access and measurement were thus difficult. At points where access was possible, e.g. the bridge at 559915,{rubbish}had been liberally tipped into it making measurements meaningless and hazardous. The other streams were mostly reduced to {trickles}or stagnant pools at this time of year. Elsewhere they had been straightened and confined to concrete channels: there was no point in measuring them.{Weeds and plant}growth were common in the channels, reflect- ing wide-scale application of fertiliser to the surrounding fields.
